column4: anyone know how to tell Ubuntu 64 bit to use the default video driver instead of the one I just installed?
anyone know how to restore previous video settings if a driver fails?  I'm getting tired of reinstalling Ubuntu
just 'cause a driver isn't set right is no reason to reinstall .. it's not windows.. there's other ways of fixing most everything.
rebooting is typically not necessary for most anything unless you get a kernel upgrade.. there are other ways.. ctrl+alt+backspace will restart the video/X/gui system
